page.title: 03Stratton School.
page.content: Grace was said before the meal commenced and at the end of the meal pupils cleared the tables and asked permission to leave the room.The teachers were called Ma'am or Sir. Pupils came from villages around the area e.g. Dunton, Arlesey and Shefford, as well as from Bedford. Today pupils still come in to school by bus but only from the nearbye villages. Stratton is now a mixed comprehensive. Pupils start at the age of thirteen in what is called the third year.Science subjects are taught separately; there are also creative lessons e.g. ceramics and metalwork. The school uniform is grey and blue,ties are worn by boys in the winter months,caps and berets are no longer worn.
